p: During 1891 to present day, influenza B viruses have been co-circulating, creating a complex immune landscape [ 73]. Influenza B was identified in 1942 and added to the influenza vaccine to create a bivalent vaccine [ 73] ( Figure 3). The WHO initiated circulating influenza virus surveillance in 1973, which led to the discovery of the B viruses lineages B/Yamagata/16/1988 (B/Yamagata lineage) and B/Victoria/2/1987 (B/Victoria lineage) in the late 1980s [ 73].
